Engine
Class Tower

java.lang.Object
  Engine.Tower

public class Tower
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a tower in the game. An object of type 'Tower' is able to decide which creeps to attack and attack on its own. Further it contains all relevant information about a tower.

Version:
0.1
Author:
Tosh

Field Detail

ID

private int ID
The tower큦 ID ingame. This ID is used to identify a tower in one single game. In any game any tower needs an ID to make it possible to exactly locate it.

towerID

private int towerID
The tower큦 Tower-ID defining the tower큦 type. This ID specializes which type of tower is represented by this class. It can choose from predefined values from the database.

ownerID

private int ownerID
The tower큦 Owner-ID specifying the tower큦 Owner. This ID has a range from 1 to 6, which is actually the maximum of players in a single game. Every player gets one ID in the beginning and all of his towers get the same one.

maxLife

private int maxLife
The tower큦 maximum life. This is the highest possible value which the variable life can take.

life

private int life
The tower큦 actual life. The height of this value correlates to the time it will take for a creep to destroy it. It is capped by the variable maxLife. In the actual state of the game it is not possible that this value gets lowered because creeps damaging towers are not implemnted.

dmg

private int dmg
The damage the tower deals with an attack. This variable defines how much damage the tower implies to a creep if the tower hits it. May be negative. In this case the tower is healing the creeps.

splash

private int splash
The range in which splash damage is dealt. This variable is defined by the distance from the hit object in which splash damage is dealt. The splash damage dealt falls equally to the distance between the attack큦 victim and the splashed creep. If this tower does not do splash damage, this should be 0.

psn

private int psn
The strength of the poison dealt by this tower큦 attacks. If the tower큦 attacks apply a poison to a creep, this will just be written into the creep큦 stats. The running engine will damage the creep according to it큦 grade of poison. If the tower doesn큧 apply poison to creeps, this should be 0.

frz

private int frz
The strength of the freeze dealt by this tower큦 attacks. If the tower큦 attacks freeze a creep, this will just be written into the creep큦 stats. The running engine will freeze the creep according to its grade of freeze. If the tower doesn큧 freeze creeps, this should be 0.

cooldown

private int cooldown
The tower큦 cooldown between attacks. This is the amount of time in game-ticks which the tower needs until he can procedure his next attack. This value needs a minimum of 1 according to the game큦 logics. The variable cooldownLeft may not take higher values than this value.

cooldownLeft

private int cooldownLeft
The tower큦 cooldown until the next attack. This is the amount of time in game-ticks until the next attack done by this tower. This value has a minimum of zero and may not take higher values than cooldown.

range

private int range
The maximum range of the tower큦 attacks. This value represents the towers shooting range in pixels (not grid-fields). A creep exactly on the limit will still be damaged. It큦 possible to do damage to creeps further away than this by dealing splash damage.

xpos

private int xpos
The tower큦 position on the x-axis. This variable specifies the tower큦 position on the x-axis. It큦 unit are grid-fields (not pixels).

ypos

private int ypos
The tower큦 position on the y-axiy. This variable specifies the tower큦 position on the y-axis. It큦 unit are grid-fields (not pixels).

shape

private java.lang.String shape
The tower큦 shape for graphics. This string is the shape큦 name. It can take values like "Rectangle", "Triangle", "Circle" etc. In later game development (when graphics are done properly) this should be replaced by the tower큦 picture큦 filename.

             int ypos,
             int range,
             int cooldown,
             int cooldownLeft,
             java.lang.String shape)
The tower큦 constructor readying it for usage. In this function all the tower큦 variables are initialized. To do so, all of these need to be given. This means the value큦 reading out of database takes place in the Game class and not here.

setOwnerID

public void setOwnerID(int ownerID)

Parameters:

Parameters:

setRange

public void setRange(int range)
Sets the tower큦 shooting range. Includes security query blocking wrong values.

Parameters:
range - the tower큦 shooting range in pixels. Must be greater than 0. Should be greater than 1/2 grid-field, so the tower can attack anything.
See Also:
getRange()

doAttack

public void doAttack(Engine.Creep[] listOfCreeps)
Procedures an attack by this tower. To do so it uses attack() which applies damage and splash damage to the creeps in listOfCreeps chosen by decideWhichToAttack. This decides which creep has the highest priority and actually just asks for the shortest way left. To use less time only creeps in range are tested, which are searched by findCreepsInRange(). This uses the position and range of this tower to find according creeps in listOfCreeps

Parameters:
listOfCreeps - the array of all creeps ingame.
See Also:
attack(Creep[] listOfCreeps, Creep victim), decideWhichToAttack(Creep[] creepsInRange), findCreepsInRange(Creep[] listOfCreeps, int x, int y, int range)

findCreepsInRange

private Engine.Creep[] findCreepsInRange(Engine.Creep[] listOfCreeps,
                                         int x,
                                         int y,
                                         int rng)
Searches for creeps in range of this tower. This function finds all creeps in the array listOfCreeps which are in range of this tower. This is done by calculating the distance to the tower for each creep and comparing it to the tower큦 range. All creeps with a distance smaller than range will be listed in an array and returned.

Parameters:
listOfCreeps - the list of all creeps ingame. This is the database for the search for the creeps in range.
x - together with y this defines the position of the tower and so the initial position to calculate with.
y - together with x this defines the position of the tower and so the initial position to calculate with.
rng - the range in which the found creeps should be.
Returns:
the list of all creeps in range of the tower.

decideWhichToAttack

private Engine.Creep decideWhichToAttack(Engine.Creep[] creepsInRange)
Searches for the creep in range with the highest priority and chooses it to be attacked. This is done by comparing all the creep큦 waysLeft and choosing all those with the littlest one. One of those will be randomly chosen to be attacked.

Parameters:
creepsInRange - the list of all creeps in the tower큦 range.
Returns:
the Creep which is chosen to be the attack큦 victim.

attack

private void attack(Engine.Creep[] listOfCreeps,
                    Engine.Creep victim)
Deals damage to a creep. This is done by at first applying the standard damage to the creep, after that the grade of poison and freeze are set and last splash damage is dealt by searching all creeps from listOfCreeps in splash range with findCreepsInRange and after that dealing damage according to the distance to the initially attacked victim.

Parameters:
listOfCreeps - the list of all Creeps ingame.
victim - the creep to be attackd.

addToArray

private java.lang.Object[] addToArray(java.lang.Object[] array,
                                      java.lang.Object obj)
Adds an object to an array.

Parameters:
obj - the object being added to an array.
array - the array for the object to be added to.
Returns:
the array with the object added. Its length is increased by 1.

calcDistance

private double calcDistance(int x1,
                            int y1,
                            int x2,
                            int y2)
Calculates the distance between two points P(x1,y1) and Q(x2,y2) using Pythagoras theorem.

Parameters:
x1 - the x-coordinate of P
y1 - the y-coordinate of P
x2 - the x-coordinate of Q
y2 - the y-coordinate of Q
Returns:
the distance between P and Q in the unit of x1, y1, x2, y2.
